The claim made by Gov: Bob McDonnell that road construction bids are the lowest in the modern era.
Clarification from McDonnell: s chief of communications, Tucker Martin, that the "modern era" refers to a period of approximately 20 years.
Confirmation from Malcolm Kerley: the chief engineer of the Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT), that VDOT does not keep annual records of the overall rise or fall in state construction bids.
Acknowledgment from Kerley that bids for: approximately 17% below VDOT's projections, due to increased competition among contractors in the construction industry.
